Responsible for Product, Technology, IT Operations, Customer Support, and Activations. Member of the executive leadership team. Digital Air Strike is the automotive social media and digital engagement company. We help our clients solve the problem of consumer engagement in digital and social environments, and help them realize measurable ROI on their digital and social marketing investments.A pioneer in digital response, social marketing and online reputation management for auto dealers, Digital Air Strike has deployed its industry-specific mobile apps, software and managed service platform to monitor, improve and manage consumer engagement for six of eight of the largest auto OEMs, dozens of the top dealer groups, and thousands of retail dealerships across the United States and Canada. Digital Air Strike is ranked in the top third of all Inc. Fastest-Growing Private Companies in the country; won the 2015 Red Herring North America Top 100 Awards, is one of the Top 10 Most Interesting and Innovative Automotive Companies, and was awarded the #1 Dealers’ Choice Award for Reputation Management. More information is available at www.digitalairstrike.com and www.facebook.com/digitalairstrike.

Founding team member responsible for designing, architecting, and building the AirMail2 product. Served as CTO initially to design/architect the product, then build and manage the development team and platform infrastructure. Once the product was built and launched, moved into an advisory role which I currently hold.

Leader of the Risk Platform Group, responsible for 4 teams (TVA, Risk Services, IW Core, Rules Management), including 5+ managers and 30+ engineers. In this role, I'm responsible for the Risk Platform for Amazon and its subsidiaries - systems that perform risk assessment on all orders, payments and third party sellers, as well as the applications used by Fraud Investigators.

eBay Enterprise Marketing Solutions helps clients acquire, engage, convert and retain customers. Responsible for software development, technical operations, and support. Member of the senior management team responsible for setting company/product vision and strategy.Currently working on developing the technology roadmap and driving innovation in the display advertising space, while building a world class team and operations.

Founded iLogon in May '08 with initial seed funding, secured additional funding in '09 to launch beta in March '09. Cash flow positive by end of 2009.Currently working with existing investors and partners on exit strategy.
Managed operations, professional services and support, while also serving as product owner for a web based medical imaging platform.

Managed the software development lifecycle, web based infrastructure, and technology partnerships for the launch of an ecommerce portal for an internet startup. Jeremy Stafford
Application Architect at Digital Air Strike
May 17, 2017, Jeremy reported directly to Anthony

Anthony is one of those really hard to find leaders in this field. He is the quintessential leader that you hear about in those leadership seminars that we've all attended. In spite of some of the most difficult of situations, Anthony always keeps a level head and his eyes & heart on the goal. He leads by example and never forgets that it is his people are the business's most important asset; the proverbial servant leader. As the CTO at Digital Air Strike, Anthony showed us that it is possible to turn an absolute train wreck into a well oiled machine in short time with minimal team friction if any at all. He was able to facilitate new processes, invest in and empower his people, and make the difficult decisions to get us back on track for success. He truly knows what it takes to create new exciting products and stay ahead of the curve in such a challenging field. It's been a privilege to work for Anthony, and I hope to again in the future.

Summer James
Director of Client Success
August 17, 2017, Anthony managed Summer directly

Summer worked for me at Digital Air Strike as Director of Customer Success. When I took on the Chief Product & Technology Officer role at DAS, I quickly realized I had a fairly significant "turnaround" project on my hands. However, Summer's department is one area I didn't have to worry about. She had already started a project of her own, and had her team moving swiftly in the right direction. That's what she does. Summer is smart, determined, and disciplined, and it shows in everything she does. In addition to managing her team, she agreed to take on the Scrum Master role. She had no experience in this area, but after working with her for a few months I was confident she could do it better than anyone else on the team. She asked the right questions up front, did some research, then took on the challenge and nailed it! Summer is the consummate professional. She knows when to ask for guidance, what questions to ask, and how to put everything together and deliver success. She has mastered the number one skill in business (in my opinion)...execution! Summer executes and delivers with quality and precision, every time.

I "inherited" Val when I joined Digital Air Strike as Chief Product & Technology Officer. There had been a lot of turmoil and movement in the product organization prior to me joining, but Val was the one constant. She knew the products, the industry, and the business, and was part of every successful product launch in the company. Val came to product management from the account management team, and with no prior product experience was able to quickly figure out the role and nail it! She just gets it. She's smart, focused, and determined, and was able to lead the team through some difficult times. I truly believe Val can solve any problem or business opportunity presented to her. I hope to have to opportunity to work with her again in the future.
